terms.definition: Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted by a provider and accessed via the internet
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to revert to previous versions and track modifications
The systematic organization, storage, and maintenance of documents and information within an organization to ensure accessibility and compliance
A unified system where all data, applications, or documents are stored and managed from a single location for easier access and control
A security model that restricts system access and document editing capabilities based on a user's specific role or job function within an organization
The ability for multiple users to work on the same document or project simultaneously with changes visible instantly to all participants
The use of software tools to automatically ensure that documentation and processes meet regulatory requirements and industry standards
The process of improving business processes and document flows to increase efficiency, reduce errors, and minimize time waste
Security measures that determine who can view, edit, or manage specific documents or system resources within an organization
The practice of protecting digital information from unauthorized access, corruption, or theft through various technical and administrative measures
Data analysis features that provide meaningful information about document usage patterns, user behavior, and system performance to improve decision-making
A pre-designed document format or structure that provides a standardized starting point for creating consistent documentation
A chronological record of document changes, user actions, and system events that provides accountability and supports compliance requirements
Work groups composed of members from different departments or specialties who collaborate on shared projects or documentation
